On 2002-06-08 at 18:03 NOUSHI Reda wrote:

>"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:
>> 
>> On 2002-06-08 at 17:11 NOUSHI Reda wrote:
>> 
>> >"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:
>> >>
>> >> On 2002-06-07 at 16:30 NOUSHI Reda wrote:
>> >>
>> >> >i have the problem shown in the subject. My class has to be told
>> some
>> >> >argumets before it can work.
<snip />

>Let me explain what the product is!
>It's a unit/interoperability testing framework for protocol
>implementations

Aha! I'm sorry that I missed that from the beginning.

In that case, since I have no experience delivering testing frameworks,
please ignore everything I say on the subject; I have no expertise and
can only give you bad advice.

>But the way we adress our implementations is by
>using CORBA. So the args are needed to initialize the ORB. It is true
>that I can use the properties file, and that's what I'll do.

Good idea. (That's safe; you can trust that one.)

>About the shipping, I need to run junit as it is my frontend and
>MyTestCase inherits from a junit class. That's why I ship junit with
the
>software.

Great. I get it. Can you merely extend JUnit, then, rather than
changing its source? Instead of inheriting from
junit.framework.TestCase, compose it -- would that work?

Thanks for clarifying; good luck.
